00061 #if (LEUART_COUNT == 1)
00062 #define LEUART_REF_VALID(ref)    ((ref) == LEUART0)
00063 #elif (LEUART_COUNT == 2)
00064 #define LEUART_REF_VALID(ref)    (((ref) == LEUART0) || ((ref) == LEUART1))
00065 #else
00066 #error "Undefined number of low energy UARTs (LEUART)."

00077 /***************************************************************************/
00088 __STATIC_INLINE void LEUART_Sync(LEUART_TypeDef *leuart, uint32_t mask)
00089 {
00090   /* Avoid deadlock if modifying the same register twice when freeze mode is */
00091   /* activated. */
00092   if (leuart->FREEZE & LEUART_FREEZE_REGFREEZE)
00093   {
00094     return;
00095   }
00096 
00097   /* Wait for any pending previous write operation to have been completed */
00098   /* in low frequency domain */
00099   while (leuart->SYNCBUSY & mask)
00100     ;
00101 }
00102

00106  **************************   GLOBAL FUNCTIONS   *******************************
00107  ******************************************************************************/

00109 /***************************************************************************/
00129 uint32_t LEUART_BaudrateCalc(uint32_t refFreq, uint32_t clkdiv)
00130 {
00131   uint32_t divisor;
00132   uint32_t remainder;
00133   uint32_t quotient;
00134   uint32_t br;
00135 
00136   /* Mask out unused bits */
00137   clkdiv &= _LEUART_CLKDIV_MASK;
00138 
00139   /* We want to use integer division to avoid forcing in float division */
00140   /* utils, and yet keep rounding effect errors to a minimum. */
00141 
00142   /*
00143    * Baudrate is given by:
00144    *
00145    * br = fLEUARTn/(1 + (CLKDIV / 256))
00146    *
00147    * which can be rewritten to
00148    *
00149    * br = (256 * fLEUARTn)/(256 + CLKDIV)
00150    *
00151    * Normally, with fLEUARTn appr 32768Hz, there is no problem with overflow
00152    * if using 32 bit arithmetic. However, since fLEUARTn may be derived from
00153    * HFCORECLK as well, we must consider overflow when using integer arithmetic.
00154    */
00155 
00156   /*
00157    * The basic problem with integer division in the above formula is that
00158    * the dividend (256 * fLEUARTn) may become higher than max 32 bit
00159    * integer. Yet we want to evaluate dividend first before dividing in
00160    * order to get as small rounding effects as possible. We do not want
00161    * to make too harsh restrictions on max fLEUARTn value either.
00162    *
00163    * For division a/b, we can write
00164    *
00165    * a = qb + r
00166    *
00167    * where q is the quotient and r is the remainder, both integers.
00168    *
00169    * The orignal baudrate formula can be rewritten as
00170    *
00171    * br = 256a / b = 256(qb + r)/b = 256q + 256r/b
00172    *
00173    * where a is 'refFreq' and b is 'divisor', referring to variable names.
00174    */
00175 
00176   divisor   = 256 + clkdiv;
00177   quotient  = refFreq / divisor;
00178   remainder = refFreq % divisor;
00179 
00180   /* Since divisor >= 256, the below cannot exceed max 32 bit value. */
00181   br = 256 * quotient;
00182 
00183   /*
00184    * Remainder < (256 + clkdiv), which means dividend (256 * remainder) worst case is
00185    * 256*(256 + 0x7ff8) = 0x80F800.
00186    */
00187   br += (256 * remainder) / divisor;
00188 
00189   return br;
00190 }

00193 /***************************************************************************/
00207 uint32_t LEUART_BaudrateGet(LEUART_TypeDef *leuart)
00208 {
00209   uint32_t          freq;
00210   CMU_Clock_TypeDef clock;
00211 
00212   /* Get current frequency */
00213   if (leuart == LEUART0)
00214   {
00215     clock = cmuClock_LEUART0;
00216   }
00217 #if (LEUART_COUNT > 1)
00218   else if (leuart == LEUART1)
00219   {
00220     clock = cmuClock_LEUART1;
00221   }
00222 #endif
00223   else
00224   {
00225     EFM_ASSERT(0);
00226     return 0;
00227   }
00228 
00229   freq = CMU_ClockFreqGet(clock);
00230 
00231   return LEUART_BaudrateCalc(freq, leuart->CLKDIV);
00232 }
00233 
00234 
00235 /***************************************************************************/
00255 void LEUART_BaudrateSet(LEUART_TypeDef *leuart,
00256                         uint32_t refFreq,
00257                         uint32_t baudrate)
00258 {
00259   uint32_t          clkdiv;
00260   CMU_Clock_TypeDef clock;
00261 
00262   /* Inhibit divide by 0 */
00263   EFM_ASSERT(baudrate);
00264 
00265   /*
00266    * We want to use integer division to avoid forcing in float division
00267    * utils, and yet keep rounding effect errors to a minimum.
00268    *
00269    * CLKDIV in asynchronous mode is given by:
00270    *
00271    * CLKDIV = 256*(fLEUARTn/br - 1) = ((256*fLEUARTn)/br) - 256
00272    *
00273    * Normally, with fLEUARTn appr 32768Hz, there is no problem with overflow
00274    * if using 32 bit arithmetic. However, since fLEUARTn may be derived from
00275    * HFCORECLK as well, we must consider overflow when using integer arithmetic.
00276    *
00277    * The basic problem with integer division in the above formula is that
00278    * the dividend (256 * fLEUARTn) may become higher than max 32 bit
00279    * integer. Yet, we want to evaluate dividend first before dividing in
00280    * order to get as small rounding effects as possible. We do not want
00281    * to make too harsh restrictions on max fLEUARTn value either.
00282    *
00283    * Since the last 3 bits of CLKDIV are don't care, we can base our
00284    * integer arithmetic on the below formula
00285    *
00286    * CLKDIV/8 = ((32*fLEUARTn)/br) - 32
00287    *
00288    * and calculate 1/8 of CLKDIV first. This allows for fLEUARTn
00289    * up to 128MHz without overflowing a 32 bit value!
00290    */
00291 
00292   /* Get current frequency? */
00293   if (!refFreq)
00294   {
00295     if (leuart == LEUART0)
00296     {
00297       clock = cmuClock_LEUART0;
00298     }
00299 #if (LEUART_COUNT > 1)
00300     else if (leuart == LEUART1)
00301     {
00302       clock = cmuClock_LEUART1;
00303     }
00304 #endif
00305     else
00306     {
00307       EFM_ASSERT(0);
00308       return;
00309     }
00310 
00311     refFreq = CMU_ClockFreqGet(clock);
00312   }
00313 
00314   /* Calculate and set CLKDIV with fractional bits */
00315   clkdiv  = (32 * refFreq) / baudrate;
00316   clkdiv -= 32;
00317   clkdiv *= 8;
00318 
00319   /* Verify that resulting clock divider is within limits */
00320   EFM_ASSERT(clkdiv <= _LEUART_CLKDIV_MASK);
00321 
00322   /* If EFM_ASSERT is not enabled, make sure we don't write to reserved bits */
00323   clkdiv &= _LEUART_CLKDIV_MASK;
00324 
00325   /* LF register about to be modified require sync. busy check */
00326   LEUART_Sync(leuart, LEUART_SYNCBUSY_CLKDIV);
00327 
00328   leuart->CLKDIV = clkdiv;
00329 }

00332 /***************************************************************************/
00352 void LEUART_Enable(LEUART_TypeDef *leuart, LEUART_Enable_TypeDef enable)
00353 {
00354   uint32_t tmp;
00355 
00356   /* Make sure the module exists on the selected chip */
00357   EFM_ASSERT(LEUART_REF_VALID(leuart));
00358 
00359   /* Disable as specified */
00360   tmp   = ~((uint32_t)(enable));
00361   tmp  &= (_LEUART_CMD_RXEN_MASK | _LEUART_CMD_TXEN_MASK);
00362   tmp <<= 1;
00363   /* Enable as specified */
00364   tmp |= (uint32_t)(enable);
00365 
00366   /* LF register about to be modified require sync. busy check */
00367   LEUART_Sync(leuart, LEUART_SYNCBUSY_CMD);
00368 
00369   leuart->CMD = tmp;
00370 }
00371 
00372 
00373 /***************************************************************************/
00400 void LEUART_FreezeEnable(LEUART_TypeDef *leuart, bool enable)
00401 {
00402   if (enable)
00403   {
00404     /*
00405      * Wait for any ongoing LF synchronization to complete. This is just to
00406      * protect against the rare case when a user
00407      * - modifies a register requiring LF sync
00408      * - then enables freeze before LF sync completed
00409      * - then modifies the same register again
00410      * since modifying a register while it is in sync progress should be
00411      * avoided.
00412      */
00413     while (leuart->SYNCBUSY)
00414       ;
00415 
00416     leuart->FREEZE = LEUART_FREEZE_REGFREEZE;
00417   }
00418   else
00419   {
00420     leuart->FREEZE = 0;
00421   }
00422 }
00423 
00424 
00425 /***************************************************************************/
00456 void LEUART_Init(LEUART_TypeDef *leuart, LEUART_Init_TypeDef const *init)
00457 {
00458   /* Make sure the module exists on the selected chip */
00459   EFM_ASSERT(LEUART_REF_VALID(leuart));
00460 
00461   /* LF register about to be modified require sync. busy check */
00462   LEUART_Sync(leuart, LEUART_SYNCBUSY_CMD);
00463 
00464   /* Ensure disabled while doing config */
00465   leuart->CMD = LEUART_CMD_RXDIS | LEUART_CMD_TXDIS;
00466 
00467   /* Freeze registers to avoid stalling for LF synchronization */
00468   LEUART_FreezeEnable(leuart, true);
00469 
00470   /* Configure databits and stopbits */
00471   leuart->CTRL = (leuart->CTRL & ~(_LEUART_CTRL_PARITY_MASK
00472                                    | _LEUART_CTRL_STOPBITS_MASK))
00473                  | (uint32_t)(init->databits)
00474                  | (uint32_t)(init->parity)
00475                  | (uint32_t)(init->stopbits);
00476 
00477   /* Configure baudrate */
00478   LEUART_BaudrateSet(leuart, init->refFreq, init->baudrate);
00479 
00480   /* Finally enable (as specified) */
00481   leuart->CMD = (uint32_t)init->enable;
00482 
00483   /* Unfreeze registers, pass new settings on to LEUART */
00484   LEUART_FreezeEnable(leuart, false);
00485 }
00486 
00487 
00488 /***************************************************************************/
00495 void LEUART_Reset(LEUART_TypeDef *leuart)
00496 {
00497   /* Make sure the module exists on the selected chip */
00498   EFM_ASSERT(LEUART_REF_VALID(leuart));
00499 
00500   /* Freeze registers to avoid stalling for LF synchronization */
00501   LEUART_FreezeEnable(leuart, true);
00502 
00503   /* Make sure disabled first, before resetting other registers */
00504   leuart->CMD = LEUART_CMD_RXDIS | LEUART_CMD_TXDIS | LEUART_CMD_RXBLOCKDIS
00505                 | LEUART_CMD_CLEARTX | LEUART_CMD_CLEARRX;
00506   leuart->CTRL       = _LEUART_CTRL_RESETVALUE;
00507   leuart->CLKDIV     = _LEUART_CLKDIV_RESETVALUE;
00508   leuart->STARTFRAME = _LEUART_STARTFRAME_RESETVALUE;
00509   leuart->SIGFRAME   = _LEUART_SIGFRAME_RESETVALUE;
00510   leuart->IEN        = _LEUART_IEN_RESETVALUE;
00511   leuart->IFC        = _LEUART_IFC_MASK;
00512   leuart->PULSECTRL  = _LEUART_PULSECTRL_RESETVALUE;
00513 #if defined(_LEUART_ROUTEPEN_MASK)
00514   leuart->ROUTEPEN   = _LEUART_ROUTEPEN_RESETVALUE;
00515   leuart->ROUTELOC0  = _LEUART_ROUTELOC0_RESETVALUE;
00516 #else
00517   leuart->ROUTE      = _LEUART_ROUTE_RESETVALUE;
00518 #endif
00519 
00520   /* Unfreeze registers, pass new settings on to LEUART */
00521   LEUART_FreezeEnable(leuart, false);
00522 }

00546 uint8_t LEUART_Rx(LEUART_TypeDef *leuart)
00547 {
00548   while (!(leuart->STATUS & LEUART_STATUS_RXDATAV))
00549     ;
00550 
00551   return (uint8_t)leuart->RXDATA;
00552 }

00573 {
00574   while (!(leuart->STATUS & LEUART_STATUS_RXDATAV))

00576 
00577   return (uint16_t)leuart->RXDATAX;

00581 /***************************************************************************/
00604 void LEUART_Tx(LEUART_TypeDef *leuart, uint8_t data)
00605 {
00606   /* Check that transmit buffer is empty */
00607   while (!(leuart->STATUS & LEUART_STATUS_TXBL))
00608     ;
00609 
00610   /* LF register about to be modified require sync. busy check */
00611   LEUART_Sync(leuart, LEUART_SYNCBUSY_TXDATA);
00612 
00613   leuart->TXDATA = (uint32_t)data;
00614 }
00615 
00616 
00617 /***************************************************************************/
00636 void LEUART_TxExt(LEUART_TypeDef *leuart, uint16_t data)
00637 {
00638   /* Check that transmit buffer is empty */
00639   while (!(leuart->STATUS & LEUART_STATUS_TXBL))
00640     ;
00641 
00642   /* LF register about to be modified require sync. busy check */
00643   LEUART_Sync(leuart, LEUART_SYNCBUSY_TXDATAX);
00644 
00645   leuart->TXDATAX = (uint32_t)data;
00646 }

00648 /***************************************************************************/
00660 void LEUART_TxDmaInEM2Enable(LEUART_TypeDef *leuart, bool enable)
00661 {
00662   /* LF register about to be modified require sync. busy check */
00663   LEUART_Sync(leuart, LEUART_SYNCBUSY_CTRL);
00664 
00665   if (enable)
00666   {
00667     leuart->CTRL |= LEUART_CTRL_TXDMAWU;
00668   }
00669   else
00670   {
00671     leuart->CTRL &= ~LEUART_CTRL_TXDMAWU;
00672   }
00673 }
00674 
00675 /***************************************************************************/
00687 void LEUART_RxDmaInEM2Enable(LEUART_TypeDef *leuart, bool enable)
00688 {
00689   /* LF register about to be modified require sync. busy check */
00690   LEUART_Sync(leuart, LEUART_SYNCBUSY_CTRL);
00691 
00692   if (enable)
00693   {
00694     leuart->CTRL |= LEUART_CTRL_RXDMAWU;
00695   }
00696   else
00697   {
00698     leuart->CTRL &= ~LEUART_CTRL_RXDMAWU;
00699   }
00700 }
